ygData.subject: RE: New resist message.
ygData.msgSnippet: Well its pretty near 25% with a charisma of 156.  Our enchanter tried his mez and got a resist rate of 8% vs the same mobs with a 158 charisma.  And his lasted
ygData.messageBody:
Well its pretty near 25% with a charisma of 156. Our enchanter tried his
mez and got a resist rate of 8% vs the same mobs with a 158 charisma. And
his lasted a heck of a lot longer than 6 seconds. I'll try to remember to
/bug that the resist message is not in red since supposedly all resist
messages are in red.

Kit

Also, sorry if I have seemed to come down really hard on Verant's Dev staff.
We have had some serious problems in the past with the same issues and had
to let people go. The funny thing is the problems they had were minor
compared to the stuff the testers at Verant let thru. I try to convince
people here how important professionalism and accepting responsibility are
and its a tough battle sometimes.

-----Original Message-----
From: kim@... [mailto:kim@...]
Sent: Wednesday, January 26, 2000 3:55 PM
To: eqbards@onelist.com
Subject: Re: [eqbards] New resist message.


From: <kim@...>

On Wed, 26 Jan 2000, Steven S. Klug wrote:
>
> I played a bit at lunch. Now that we have a the
> secondary resist message on Lullaby, it is
> disturbingly easy to see just how incredibly
> poorly lullaby works. I was fighting groups of
> faeries in lfay (that are barely blue to me) and
> getting less than 50% success rate at lullabying
> them. This is with singing the song continuously
> like GZ said we should.

That's my hope - that once it becomes obvious how poorly the
song works (whereas before people could just say it was our
imagination), enough people will complain that they'll unnerf
it. Send /feedback saying that the new resist message should
be red, not blue. That will make it even more obvious. :)

Meanwhile I'm going to try getting my charisma up around 200
(still need a couple more items) and see what the resist rate
on level 1 mobs is like.

--
John H. Kim
kim@...
